trainSet

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • trainSet.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    The Database class provides the interface to query the SQLite database. Specifically, it contains methods designed to perform the insertion, erase and retrieve of information from the tables in which the database is made.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database(java.lang.String path) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeConnection()
      Closes the current connection
      void connectionValidator()
      Validator of the connection
      java.util.ArrayList<Model> getClickedModels(FileType fileType)
      This method allows you to extract all models that have the "CHECKED" field set to "1" from the table indicated by Database.getTableName(fileType)
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Get of the connection
      static java.lang.String getTableName(FileType fileType)
      This static method allows to get the proper name of the table for the type specified by "fileType".
      void insertIntoTable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String path, FileType fileType)
      This method allows you to enter an element named "name" and with "path" path in the FileType table "fileType".
      boolean removeFromTable(java.lang.String name, FileType fileType)
      This method allows you to delete an element named "name" from the table indicated by the "fileType"
      java.util.ArrayList<Model> retrieveFromTable(FileType fileType)
      This method allows to query the database and to extract all the models of the specified FileType.
      void setConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
      Set of the connection
      void updateClicked(java.lang.String selectedName, int clicked, FileType fileType)
      This method allows you to set the value of the "CHECKED" field to "clicked" performing an update query in the appropriate table based on "fileType"
